tasting_notes.aroma: Blackberry, plum, cedar, tobacco, and earthy undertones.
tasting_notes.palate: Rich and structured with dark fruit flavors, velvety tannins, and a touch of spice.
tasting_notes.body: Full-bodied with a well-integrated balance of fruit and acidity.
tasting_notes.finish: Long and lingering with notes of black cherry and cocoa.

dish_1.name: Grilled Ribeye Steak with Peppercorn Sauce
dish_1.explanation: The wine's firm tannins and dark fruit flavors complement the char and richness of the steak, while the peppercorn sauce adds a spicy kick that matches the wine’s depth.

dish_2.name: Duck Breast with Blackberry Reduction
dish_2.explanation: The acidity and fruitiness of the blackberry sauce mirror the wine’s dark berry notes, while the duck’s fatty richness balances the tannins.

dish_3.name: Roasted Portobello Mushrooms with Balsamic Glaze
dish_3.explanation: The earthy umami of the mushrooms enhances the wine’s tobacco and cedar notes, while balsamic glaze provides a sweet-tart contrast.

dish_4.name: Aged Comté Cheese with Walnuts
dish_4.explanation: The nutty complexity of Comté aligns with the wine’s structured tannins, while walnuts add texture that enhances the wine’s mouthfeel.

dish_5.name: Dark Chocolate Tart with Raspberry Coulis
dish_5.explanation: The cocoa flavors of the tart echo the wine’s chocolatey finish, while the raspberry coulis adds a bright acidity that keeps the pairing fresh.

dish_6.name: Slow-Braised Lamb Shank with Rosemary and Garlic
dish_6.explanation: The deep flavors of the lamb are softened by slow cooking, allowing the wine’s fruit and spice elements to shine, while rosemary and garlic add aromatic complexity.
